class_notes: The delivery format listed for this class is based on current university guidelines.  However, if there are further changes to the COVID19 guidelines for Fall 2021 or other acts beyond our control, the school reserves the right the modify the delivery method for this class.
course_description: Virtually every aspect of business is instrumented for data collection and data is increasingly analyzed systematically to improve business decision-making and offer competitive advantage. In this class, we will study the fundamental principles and techniques of data mining in order to extract useful information and knowledge from data. We will improve our ability to approach problems "data-analytically", we will examine real-world examples that place data mining in context, and we will apply data-mining techniques while working hands-on with a data mining software.
prerequisites: ISOM 351 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.This section is reserved for students in the BBA program.
schedule_location: MW 4pm-5:15pm in Goizueta Foundation Ctr W330
